1.brief: properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
an intoxicant, i.e. intensely alcoholic liquor
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to stray (causatively, mislead), usually (figuratively) to mistake, especially (morally) to transgress; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) to reel, (figuratively) be enraptured
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be wise (in mind, word or act)

2.brief: a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
fright; concrete, an idol (as a bugbear)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

3.brief: properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

4.brief: properly, the crop gathered, i.e. (by implication) the autumn (and winter) season; figuratively, ripeness of age
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

5.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
properly, to dangle, i.e. to let down abucket (for drawing out water); figuratively, to deliver

6.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

7.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)

8.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
to toss about; by implication, to diffuse, winnow
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

9.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to be translucent; figuratively, to be innocent
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to be pure (physical sound, clear, unadulterated; Levitically, uncontaminated; morally, innocent or holy)
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

10.brief: an ephah or measure for grain; hence, a measure in general
an ephah or measure for grain; hence, a measure in general
properly, something disgusting (morally), i.e. (as noun) an abhorrence; especially idolatry or (concretely) an idol
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

11.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not

12.brief: broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

13.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
to open (the senses, especially the eyes); figuratively, to be observant
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

14.brief: bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
to go away, hence, to disappear
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

15.brief: there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)
value, i.e. (concretely) wealth; abstractly, costliness, dignity
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

16.brief: to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)
to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)

17.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
properly, something cutting; hence, gravel (as grit); an arrow

18.brief: a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
(only in plural) properly, steerage (as a management of ropes), i.e. (figuratively) guidance or (by implication) a plan
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

19.brief: to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to open, i.e. be (causatively, make) roomy; usually figuratively (in a mental or moral sense) to be (causatively, make) simple or (in a sinister way) delude
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange)

20.brief: to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
to be extinguished; figuratively, to expire or be dried up
a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively)
the little man of the eye; the pupil or ball; hence, the middle (of night)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness

21.brief: properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
first, in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun)
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)

22.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

23.brief: properly, something disgusting (morally), i.e. (as noun) an abhorrence; especially idolatry or (concretely) an idol
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(only in the dual) a pair of scales
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

24.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

25.brief: a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised
properly, to plough, or (generally) break forth, i.e. (figuratively) to inspect, admire, care for, consider

26.brief: to toss about; by implication, to diffuse, winnow
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

27.brief: a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything

28.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

29.brief: ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
properly, selected, i.e. a youth (often collective)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

30.brief: properly, bound (with stripes), i.e. a weal (or black-and-blue mark itself)
to polish; by implication, to sharpen; also to rinse
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a wound; figuratively, carnage, also pestilence
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
